data.text: @Chris62292743 @MayorofLondon Toilet traffic means extra footfall for a business. Making toilet provision mandatory means no business is disadvantaged. If toilets are everywhere, nobody takes advantage, because they can go wherever they go, and won't use the toilets of a business unless they are inside anyway
@chrislowndes @MayorofLondon As long as the council are paying towards shop owners water rates.

@Jimmy60205604 @MayorofLondon That's my kind of humor

@WigleyDarren @Sunnyjim1977 @MayorofLondon Unfortunately vigilantism will be the only option left because after all this time @metpoliceuk still haven’t managed to prevent these thieves from committing highway robbery on the same streets in Lisson Grove area on a daily basis - according to regular drivers reports on here.

@CaliKora @Akcobra427 @MayorofLondon Are you some sort of twat making excuses for that waste of space Khan tweet  you opinion to people who care about drinking water only not the rest of us who worry about being stabbed idiot
@MayorofLondon 😂😂😂😂 Rickshaw rip offs,  moped muggings, almost Daily stabbings and the best you come up with is water fountains,   A total waste of money    Do London a favour and GO

@GoonerSNe @MayorofLondon Police get back 5% of millions they spend policing football matches....maybe we could start saving public money there instead of blowing the crime is out of control because we have a Muslim/Labour/Terrorist sympathiser mayor whistle?

@WigleyDarren @Sunnyjim1977 @canty_michael @MayorofLondon The why things are going I can see civil unrest happen really soon, all because of a stupid vote. It's really sad when I see and elderly person stand with a group of youths hurling abuse at someone because they're European. As for hurting cabbie, it's **** to the ready.

@MayorofLondon #legacy

@MayorofLondon Oh, so that’s why we’ve needed a Mayor all this time. Good to see there is something you can do. 👏👏

@penckagancheva @MayorofLondon Funny that. As a Londoner for the last 35 years, I only suffered from 2 crimes - both commited by drug-addicted middle-class Englishmen. Both times the police helped despite huge constraints on resources from central government. But I often need a pee at the station.
@sirpercy73 @MayorofLondon These fountains will be good for people who have been attacked by acid as that is on the increase under your watch! You need to get your priorities right Mayor!!! #khanout

@chrislowndes @MayorofLondon Well
Londoners would prefer to pee in their pants and be alive rather than peeing in a loo and the tube station and being stabbed. Crimes need sorting first. Rest is easy.

@MayorofLondon 20 and £50k 😂... is this even news? Just get on the with what you are being paid to do and stop messing about with cheap PR like this. Who in their right mind would want to drink from these anyway? Imagine the diseases 🙈
@MayorofLondon Water fountains REALLY? Knife crime and people living on the streets, should come as a priority surely? The capital and the rest of the country is going down hill fast!
@MayorofLondon Too little too late as summer is well and truly over.

@MayorofLondon Why not create kiosks manned by 2 policemen or community officers on the street in sensitive areas of London to counter mugging by moped riding criminals and check knife killings. At least in this way you can assure public of police presence on the streets

@MayorofLondon 😂😂😂

@hands313 @Rob11211 @MayorofLondon Again why so snarky? I meant not many near me and one I know involves a water fountain. It may be useful so I have downloaded it but my view is that anything we do to reduce our use of plastic is a good thing. Enjoy the rest of your day and maybe calm down.
